name: Font Family
content:
# Font Family
The `font-family` property specifies the font for an element. There are two types of font family names:
* `family-name` - The name of a `font-family`, like `times`, `courier`, `arial`, etc.
* `generic-family` - The name of a `generic-family`, like `serif`, `sans-serif`, `cursive`, `fantasy`, `monospace`.

examples.name: Multiple Font Families
examples.description:
Setting the font of a `

` element.

short_description:
Font Family
The font-family property specifies the font for an element. There are two types of font family names:
 family-name - The name of a font-family, like times, courier, arial, etc.
 generic-family - The name of a generic-family, like serif, sans-serif, cursive, fantasy, monospace.
tips:
* You can specify a list of fonts, from highest priority to lowest. If the browser does not support the first font, it tries the next font.
* When listing multiple font families, make sure to separate each value with a comma.
